isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 1000 SERIES - ADJUSTMENT

svcproc.title: ADJUSTMENT
svcproc.para: To assure correct clutch operation and long service life of the clutch components, the clutch and linkage must be kept in proper adjustment.
Adjustment must be made periodically to compensate for wear of the clutch disc facings (as indicated by reduction of pedal free travel) and at the time of clutch control linkage service.
Adjustment factors are clutch release bearing clearance and clutch pedal free travel. Pedal free travel is determined by release bearing clearance.
To obtain specified release bearing to clutch finger clearance ( Figure 2), adjust the clutch linkage as outlined. This adjustment will provide specified pedal free travel.

step1.para: Loosen the lower (horizontal) clutch control rod adjusting yoke lock nut.
Remove the cotter and clevis pins and disconnect the lower control rod from the relay lever.
Insert a .38" (9.65 mm) spacer gauge between clutch pedal shank and pedal return stop. (Gauge can be made locally.)
Pull the lower control rod forward until the release bearing contacts the clutch fingers.
Holding the rod in the forward position (per Step 4), adjust the control rod yoke until the clevis pin can be freely inserted through the yoke and relay lever.
Tighten the control rod yoke lock nut and install a new cotter pin.
Operate clutch pedal and check clutch release. Clutch should fully release before clutch pedal contacts pedal travel stop. If necessary, adjust pedal travel stop to obtain full clutch release.
